name: ONE HUNDRED ROOMS
description:
ONE HUNDRED ROOMS is a minimalistic roguelike written in Python, influenced by tabletop dungeon crawling, the Australian outback, and the original Rogue.  

You play a Nameless Champion, bracing themselves against a vicious onslaught of antagonistic wildlife and a merciless labyrinth. 

The game was originally designed as a minimal and programmatic-generation-focused experiment in single-script Python gaming, running natively on OSX via Terminal, during a period of unemployment at the start of the pandemic. It has now been packaged as a .exe for the first time in 2022!

Can you survive ONE HUNDRED ROOMS?

  • Code: Tom Gilmore
  • Game design: Tom Gilmore & Alex Tulett
  • Lore: Alex Tulett & Tom Gilmore
  • ASCII fonts: 'Bloody' & 'Calvin S' @ patorjk.com
  • (c) 2020, Tom Gilmore & Alex Tulett
